docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: How extraordinary that Congress, while raising other taxes by $50 billion, has recommended cutting the excise tax on cigarettes in half - dropping it back to what it was 30 years ago. The action is a tremendous windfall for the tobacco industry at the expense of the American people.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: In a June 5 letter, Lawrence Garfinkel of the American Cancer Society complained about R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company's public-issue messages regarding passive smoking, in which he is quoted. Space does not permit a reply to all of his complaints, but his letter is noteworthy in two respects that demonstrate one of the major reasons why Reynolds has undertaken its public-issues program. Mr. Garfinkel does not dispute either the accuracy or the meaning of the quotations used in our issue advertisements. However, because he is opposed to the position taken by Reynolds, he complains that his words were quoted out of context.
